dublin_core.dcvalue: Definition of Respiratory Failure using PaO2 alone is confounded when patients are commenced on oxygen therapy prior to arterial blood gas ABG measurement Furthermore classification of Respiratory Failure as Type 1 or Type 2 using PaCO2 alone can give an inaccurate account of events as both types can co exist 100 consecutive presentations of acute respiratory distress were assessed initially using PaO2 and subsequently PaO2 FiO2 ratio to diagnose Respiratory Failure Respiratory Failure cases were classified as Type 1 or Type 2 initially using PaCO2 and subsequently alveolar arterial A a gradient Any resultant change in management was documented Of 100 presentations an additional 16 cases were diagnosed as Respiratory Failure using PaO2 FiO2 ratio in place of PaO2 alone p 0 0338 Of 57 cases of Respiratory Failure 22 cases classified as Type 2 using PaCO2 alone were reclassified as Type 1 using A a gradient p Under 0 001 Of these 22 cases management changed in 18
SMART phones and the acute respiratory patient.
